name: polygonatum biflorum
description: Also called Polygonatum canaliculatum or Great Solomon's Seal, this plant has long, arching stems that dangle cream-colored flowers early spring.  Large purple seeds and golden leaves add interest in fall.  Germination takes time (note code F, below) but it is well-invested; plants spread slowly and form colonies once established.  Solomon's Seal can grow in full sun or full shade.  Dormant bare root plants ship each year during optimal transplanting season: Fall (October) or Spring (April/May).
features: Pollinator Favorite: butterflies, bees and birds
